contents.description:
This section contains information about some of Vue components that can be used in markdown files.
Explore them to highlight specific content and make your pages interactive.

contents.title: 1. Notice
contents.description: The Notice component (components/content/Notice.vue) is created to highlight some part of the text.

children.value: ) is created to highlight some part of the text.
) is displayed like an underlined word, but it also can create popup with its definition.
To see definition, hover the term. To close popup, click outside or move mouse outside the popup window and wait.
All terms definitions should be created as
: string - name of the term (if not defined explicitly, first level header will become title)
: list of strings - additional spellings of the term

contents.title: 3. Mermaid.js
contents.description: Mermaid.js is a JavaScript library that allows you to generate diagrams using a simple markdown-like syntax. It is used to generate the diagrams in this documentation template.

children.value: Mermaid.js is a JavaScript library that allows you to generate diagrams using a simple markdown-like syntax. It is used to generate the diagrams in this documentation template.
Mermaid diagrams are supported in GitHub and GitLab file explorers.

contents.title: Deployment
contents.description: Generate static HTML files from your documentation with npx nuxt generate command and it will be ready to be deployed to the web.

children.value: Generate static HTML files from your documentation with
command and it will be ready to be deployed to the web.

There are several ways to deploy documentation to the web.
Check out the documentation for details:

contents.title: 1. Web-server
contents.description:
While in project directory, use npm run generate command do get html files, that you will place to your server via SSH or any other way.
All generated files located in two directories:

children.value:
command do get html files, that you will place to your server via SSH or any other way.
All generated files located in two directories:
Remember: you need to configure CI/CD to automatically get new html files every time content changed.
Use static hosting instructions for your web-server to configure it properly (

contents.title: 2. Netlify
contents.description:
Netlify is a zero-config provider for Nuxt-based applications.
Connect Netlify to publicly available github/gitlab repository and service will do it for you.

children.value:
Netlify is a zero-config provider for Nuxt-based applications.
Connect Netlify to publicly available github/gitlab repository and service will do it for you.

contents.title: 3. GitHub pages
contents.description: Check GitHub pages official guide to configure it properly.

props.code:
name: Build & Deploy

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
  push:
    branches:
      - master

jobs:
  build-and-deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v1

      - name: Use Node.js 16
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 16

      - name: Installing packages
        run: npm ci

      - name: Build Nuxt 3 static site
        run: npx nuxt generate

      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
        if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/master'
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_dir: ./dist

children.value: You probably need to configure prefix for your website, visit

contents.title: 4. GitLab pages
contents.description: To deploy your website using GitLab pages, create project for your docs website based on this template and follow official guide to configure GitLab CLI.

children.value: To deploy your website using GitLab pages, create project for your docs website based on this template and follow
You need to store static files in artifacts of your GitLab project and then configure pages to host static files from artifacts.
to find more details about GitLab CI configuration.

props.code:
image: node:16
stages:
  - build
build-docs:
  stage: build
  script:
    - npm ci
    - npx nuxt generate
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - dist/*

children.value: You probably need to configure prefix for your website, visit
